result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Cardenas Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ruben Cardenas Jr in court.  Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler in court for Ruben Cardenas Jr.  Assistant District Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for the State of Wisconsin for Matthew Torbenson.  
The defense has not filed a report regarding DNA .  
Defense is requesting a status date, the court advised parties a plea hearing date will be set out and if a trial is necessary it will be scheduled on the plea date.  mn
Plea hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 21, 2022; received and filed.
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce DNA Evidence at Trial; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Ruben Cardenas Jr in court.  Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler in court for Ruben Cardenas Jr.  Attorney Alicia Kort in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Matthew James Torbenson. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense is waiting for DNA report and requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled a return on DNA report.  Case adjourned to Branch 45, Rm G55A CJF.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-30-2022, Filed.

Defendant Ruben Cardenas in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruben Cardenas appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing on defense's motion to waive defendant's in-person check-in with Justice Point while the defendant recovers from a leg fracture. State has no objection.   Bail motion by defense granted by the Court.
Parties requests time to review crime lab results. Scheduled jury trial is vacated.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail, filed.

Defendant Ruben Cardenas in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruben Cardenas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Continued from 5.16.22.  
re firearm:   Attorney Kuchler outlines parameters of request to reinstatement of firearm possession; motion denied and may be revisited with job offer.
re contact with DMR:  Counsel to work out a mutually acceptable date for transfer of property without victim being present.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JPS report

Defendant Ruben Cardenas in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruben Cardenas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendants bail motions re Firearm restriction: taken under advisement pending employment offer.  re contact with DMR:  court needs a specific schedule and supervision for the transfer of personal property.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
JPS report
re conditions
22RM021129  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 04/13/2022
for Substitution

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Yamahiro, Br. 34.

Defendant Ruben Cardenas in court with Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Matthew Torbenson appeared in for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Adjustment Number: 22A 036331,
Payable Number: 999741,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with: PER 4/28/2008 DOB; DMR 4/21/1971 DOB (PERs mother); RMR (PERs sister); and LKR (PERs sister).  NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH ANY CHILDREN UNDER AGE 18
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Ruben Cardenas in court with attorney Zachary Hoff, as friend of Court.  Defendant Ruben Cardenas in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruben Cardenas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
